{"id":1127065325,"question_id":3250,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"5 months, 3 weeks","timestamp":1703387341,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"1566 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1127065325/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Maximum Square Area by Removing Fences From a Field","memory":"93.4 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public int maximizeSquareArea(int h, int w, int[] hFences, int[] vFences) {\n        int M = (int) 1e9+7;\n        \n        HashSet<Integer> hset = new HashSet<>();\n        HashSet<Integer> wset = new HashSet<>();\n        \n        getAll(hFences, hset, h);\n        getAll(vFences, wset, w);\n        \n        List<Integer> hList = new ArrayList<>(hset);\n        // List<Integer> wList = new ArrayList<>(wset);\n        \n        Collections.sort(hList);\n        // Collections.sort(wList);\n        \n        for(int i=hList.size()-1; i>0; i--){\n            if( wset.contains(hList.get(i)))\n                return (int)(1L * hList.get(i) *hList.get(i)  %M) ;\n        }\n        \n        return -1;\n        \n    }\n    \n    \n    private void getAll(int[] fences, HashSet<Integer> set, int max){\n        for(int f : fences){\n            set.add(f-1); // 1, 4\n        }\n        set.add(max-1);// 8\n        \n          // System.out.println(set);\n        \n        List<Integer> list = new ArrayList<>(set);\n        \n        for(int a : list){\n            for(int b :list){\n                set.add(Math.abs(a-b));\n            }\n        }\n        \n         // System.out.println(set);\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"maximum-square-area-by-removing-fences-from-a-field","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
